messages.message:
Hi Team, 
SC reported this error "All records had a runtime exception. Last error observed was: No ib error found.', when executing the flow. Timeline log shows the job completed successfully. 

Few observations on the above issue:
• Failing when trying to write barcode to the output
• Error "byte like object is required not an image”. Same flow was working good prior to todays run. Prod is in Oct release
• Same flow working good in their non prod. Non Prod - Dec release
Code snippet where its failing:
def barcode_generator(text,clients,**kwargs):
    try: 
        EAN = barcode.get_barcode_class('code39')
        rv = BytesIO()
        z = EAN(text, writer=ImageWriter(),add_checksum=False)
        *z.write(rv,options={"write_text": False})*
        return rv
    except Exception as e:   
        tb =traceback.format_exc()
        return str(tb) (edited)

TypeError: a bytes-like object is required, not 'Image'
Any idea what's happening?
@arun Can you check the barcode package version between the 2 environments?
@Hari - Checked both environments. Packages are same in 2 environments
who’s the owner of this barcode generator function? and can you attach the batch.ibflowresult file? more error msgs should be there hopefully
@Kerry It's an independent package that SC is using in a UDF! Strangely we couldn't simulate locally or in our environments.. I will take the call with the SC team tomorrow morning and update here!
